posts.post_content: Great seller, great card Greg, good luck with the sale
May I get a back scan?

I will take it.
Please message PayPal info.
Thanks,
Gary.
Card sold at 11:10am (apparently priced too cheap)

[quote name="markmcc201" post=1556921]What did it sell for?[/QUOTE]

It sold for whatever the buyer paid for it.

[quote name="ScottR81" post=1556923]It sold for whatever the buyer paid for it.[/QUOTE]

Thanks for your comment it is so helpful in trying to determine what things sell for and what they may be worth.

[quote name="markmcc201" post=1556927]Thanks for your comment it is so helpful in trying to determine what things sell for and what they may be worth.[/QUOTE]

AT least he could of kept the asking price...

As always, this is the Seller's prerogative.  He is under no obligation to leave the sale price up.

If it's truly vital information to you, a PM to the Seller is typically well-received.

And a nice pickup!

So did I buy it since I was the first to respond?
Looking for PP information still...
Gary.
Shouldn't the guy who posted 40 minutes before you claim you sold the item saying he will take it get the card?

[quote name="111gecko" post=1556944]So did I buy it since I was the first to respond?
Looking for PP information still...
Gary.[/QUOTE]

Looks like you only agreed to buy the card an hour or so before he sold it...i think you needed to buy it at least an hour before he was going to list the card for sale..

if end up not getting the card, you can at least say what the price the guy was asking to resolve the big mystery
I assume Greg got a PM or email from someone before Gary posted he would take it.

[quote name="Peter_Spaeth" post=1556954]I assume Greg got a PM or email from someone before Gary posted he would take it.[/QUOTE]

This is correct.

Edited to add for Mark: a card is worth what a person is willing to pay for it, IMHO.
Initial listed price was between 800 and 900, cannot recall actual number. Nice pickup to whoever got the card!
